I have to test a class that is calling a stored procedure in a local database .
 
Is there a method to populate the database from the junit other than the dbunit . The junit should be such that it doesnt fail, as i am passing a parameter to my class method eg a telephone number and my unit test will be successful only if this is found in the table and if it is not in the table then my test fails which i want to avoid .
 
Is there any way this can be achieved other than the dbunit in which the database is populated with the required data . 
 
Also if i throw a sql exception i want to test that too which i am unable to do right now .
 
How can i generate a sql exception or do i have to write a stub . what will be the right aproach . 
 
 
Can anybody through some light on this 
 
Danmeet
